p: 326. That depends on the cover of ragwort (and on whether there was a mixing effect). If there is a perfect mixture of grasses and ragwort, your results suggest a neutral effect. If ragwort is abundant, then there would be a negative impact of leaving litter on ragwort germination. Also, is ragwort litter commonly removed by burning or raking? It is important to note that litter has different physical and chemical properties than green biomass, so this isnâ€™t exactly comparable to land manager mowing and leaving the trimmings in field.
